meanings.definition: Fluorochromes: fluorescent molecules used in biological research for labeling and imaging cells.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use fluorochromes to make cells glow under a microscope.
meanings.sent2: The fluorochromes emitted a bright green light when exposed to the laser.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous scientist accidentally spilled fluorochromes all over the lab, turning everything neon.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement was like a room filled with fluorochromes, lighting up the entire place.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the fluorochromes made the dull cells come to life in the images.

meanings.definition: Fluorochromes: substances that emit light of a specific color when exposed to light of a different color.
meanings.sent1: The fluorochromes in the experiment glowed red when hit by blue light.
meanings.sent2: Under UV light, the fluorochromes displayed a stunning array of colors.
meanings.sent3: The party decorations were like fluorochromes, changing hues with every flicker of the disco ball.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a burst of fluorochromes in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The fluorochromes shone like tiny stars in the night sky, each with its unique color.

meanings.definition: Fluorochromes: dyes that are used to stain biological samples for visualization under a microscope.
meanings.sent1: The biologist carefully applied the fluorochromes to the tissue sample for better visibility.
meanings.sent2: The fluorochromes highlighted the specific structures within the cell, aiding in analysis.
meanings.sent3: The artist mistakenly used fluorochromes instead of regular paint, creating a vibrant but unintended masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The fluorochromes danced across the slide, revealing the hidden details of the specimen.
meanings.sent5: The fluorochromes transformed the plain slide into a colorful canvas of biological wonders.
